a
1. prefix ā shortened before a double consonant. 2. a negative prefixed to nouns, adjectives; and participles. 3. the augment prefixed to some roots in the Past and Conditional Tenses; e.g. akāsi.
prefix
ariyasacca
an established fact; noble truth.
nt.
aṃsa
1. a part; a side; 2. shoulder.
m.; nt.
aṃsakūṭa
shoulder.
nt.
aṃsabandhana
shoulder strap.
nt.
aṃsu
ray of light; a fibre.
m.
aṃsuka
cloth.
nt.
aṃsumālī
the sun.
m.
akaṅkhamāna
wishing; desiring.
pr.p. of ākaṅkhati
akaṭa
1. not done; not made; 2. not artificial.
adj.
akaḍḍhati
pulls; drags.
ā + kaḍḍh + a
akaḍḍhi
pulled; dragged.
aor. of akaḍḍhati
akata
1. not done; not made; 2. not artificial.
adj.
akataññu
ungrateful.
adj.
akatattā
because one has not done.
ind.
akanta
unpleasant.
adj.
akampiya
immovable; stable; firm.
adj.
akaraṇa
non-action.
nt.
akaraṇīya
that should not be done; (nt.), improper action.
pt.p. of
akari
did.
aor.
akaronta
not doing or performing.
pr.p.
akā
did.
aor.
akāca
flowless.
adj.
akāmaka
unwilling.
adj.
akāla
inappropriate. (adj.), out of reason.
m.
akāsi
did, made, or performed.
aor. of karoti.
akiñcana
having nothing.
adj.
akiṭila
straight; honest; not crooked.
adj.

pouring.
pr.p. of
akiriya

nt.
akiriyavāda

m.

adj.

adj.

adj.

nt.
akovida

adj.

m.
akkanta

pp. of akkamati

nt.

nt.

aor. of akkamati
akkamma

abs.
akkuṭṭha

pp. of akkosati
akkocchi

aor. of akkosati

m.

m.

abs. of akkosati
akkha
sense organ. (m.), axle; dice; beleric myrobalan; a measurement equal to 20 grains. (akkha in the cpds. such as visālakkha, sahasakkha is from the stem akkhi = eye).
nt.
akkhaka
collar-bone.
nt.
akkhaṇa
inappropriate time.
m.
akkhaṇavedhī

m.
akkhaṇā

f.
akkhata

adj.
akkhadassa

m.
akkhadhutta

adj.
akkhaya

adj.
akkhara
a letter; a syllable.
nt.
akkharaphalaka

m.
akkharasamaya

m.

(adj.), bitter. (nt.), bitter taste.
adj., nt.

adj.

f.

m.
tittha

nt.
titthakara

m.
titthāyatana
the sphere of a religious sect; the fundamental doctrine (of any religion).
(tittha + āyatana), nt.
titthiya

m.

m.

m.

adj.
pañcapaññāsati
fifty-five.
f.
pañcapatiṭṭhita
fivefold prostration (with forehead, waist, elbows, knees and feet).
nt.
pañcabandhana
fivefold bandage.
nt.
pañcabala
five mental forces.
nt.
pañcamahāpariccāga
fivefold great liberalities, viz: of the most value things, sons, wives, kingdoms, and limbs.
m.
pañcamahāvilokana
fivefold investigation of a Bodhisatta, viz: of time, continent, place, clan, and mother.
nt.
pañcavaggiya
belonging to a group of five. (The five monks, who accompanied Gotama when he became an ascetic, are called pañcavaggiyā).
adj.
pañcavaṇṇa
of five colors, viz: blue, yellow, white, red, and brown.
adj.
pañcavidha
fivefold.
adj.
pañcavīsati
twenty-five.
f.
pañcasaṭṭhi
sixty-five.
f.
pañcasata
five hundred.
nt.
pañcasattati
seventy-five.
f.
pañcasahassa
five thousand.
nt.
pañcasīla
the five moral precepts.
nt.
pañcaso
by five or in five ways.
ind.
pañcahattha
measuring five cubits.
adj.
pañcānantariya
the five acts that have immediate retribution, viz: matricide, patricide, murdering of a holy person, wounding a Buddha, and making a schism in the community of monks.
nt.
pañcābhiññā
five physic powers, viz: power of performing miracles, clair-audience, clairvoyance, knowing other's thoughts, and collecting one's previous births.
f.
pañcāvudha
a set of five weapons, viz: sword, spear battle-axe, bow and mace.
nt.
pañcāsīti
eighty-five.
f.
pañcāha
five days.
nt.
pañcūḷaka
having five topknots of hair.
adj.
pañjara
a cage.
m.
pañjali
holding up the clasped hands as token of salutation.
adj.
pañjalika
holding up the clasped hands as token of salutation.
adj.
pañña
wise; endowed with knowledge. (in cpds.).
adj.
paññata
appeared; was clear or evident.
pp. of paññāyati
paññatā
(in cpds.), the fact of having wisdom.
f.
paññatta
regulated or made a rule; made known; declared; prepared (a set, etc.).
pp. of paññāpeti
paññatti

f.
paññavant
wise; intelligent.
adj.
paññā

f.
paññākkhandha

m.
paññācakkhu
the eye of wisdom.
nt.
paññāṇa

nt.
paññādhana
the treasure of wisdom.
nt.
paññāpaka

adj.
paññāpana

nt.
paññāpita

f.

pp. of pāpuṇāti

f.
patti

m.
pattika

adj.

nt.
pattuṃ

inf. of pāpuṇāti

nt.
